title: UK Visa Application from Nepal
content: You can apply for a UK visa up to 6 months before your course starts if applying from outside the UK, or 3 months before if applying from within the UK. [1]  The British Embassy in Kathmandu represents the UK government in Nepal and provides services to British nationals. [3]

citations.quote: The earliest you can apply for a visa is 6 months before you start your course.
The earliest you can apply is 3 months before your course starts.
Our work covers a range of issues including representing the British government in its relations with the Nepalese government and the people of Nepal.

title: UK Student Visa Requirements for Nepali Students
content: To apply for a UK Student visa, you must be 16 or older. Those aged 16 or 17 intending to study at an independent school may be eligible for a Child Student visa. The Student visa has replaced the Tier 4 (General) student visa. [1]

title: Required Documents for UK Student Visa
content: Essential documents: valid passport/travel document and Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS). You may also need: proof of funds, ATAS certificate (if applicable), parental/guardian consent (if under 18), proof of relationship to parent/guardian (if under 18), tuberculosis test results, and financial sponsor's written consent (if applicable). [2]

citations.quote:
When you apply for your Student visa you must provide:
- a current passport or other valid travel documentation
- a Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) from your course provider
You may also need to provide:
- proof you have enough money to support yourself and pay for your course - this will vary depending on your circumstances
- a valid ATAS certificate if your course and nationality require it
- proof of parental or other legal guardian consent if you’re under 18
- proof of your relationship to your parent or guardian if you’re under 18
- your tuberculosis test results
- written consent for your application from your financial sponsor if you’ve received sponsorship for your course fees and living costs in the last 12 months

title: Additional Requirements for Applicants Under 18
content: Applicants under 18 need written consent from both parents/legal guardians (or one if they have sole responsibility) for the visa application, living arrangements, and travel to the UK. A copy of the birth certificate or another government-issued document showing parents' names is also required. [2]

citations.quote:
If you’re under 18 you’ll need written consent from both parents or legal guardians (or one parent if they have sole responsibility).
This must include their consent for:
- your visa application
- your living and care arrangements in the UK
- your travel to the UK
You’ll also need to provide a copy of your birth certificate (or another government issued document) that shows the names of your parents.

title: Passport
content: **Description:** A valid passport with at least two blank pages and valid for the duration of your stay. **Obtaining in Nepal:** Department of Passport, Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Application process involves online form submission, biometrics collection, and interview. **Processing Time:** Varies, can take up to several weeks. Expedited service available at an additional cost. **Cost:** NPR 5,000 for 34 pages, NPR 10,000 for 66 pages (as of November 2023). **Validity:** Must be valid for the entire duration of your stay in the UK. **Common Mistakes:** Expiring passport, insufficient blank pages. **Example:** A Nepali citizen applies for a 34-page passport at the Department of Passport in Kathmandu.

title: Financial Proof
content:
**Description:** Evidence of sufficient funds to cover your tuition fees and living expenses in the UK. **Obtaining in Nepal:** Bank statements, fixed deposit certificates, loan sanction letters from recognized banks. **Processing Time:** Depends on the bank. **Cost:**  Bank charges may apply. **Validity:** Statements must cover a 28-day period ending no more than 31 days before the date of your visa application. **Common Mistakes:** Insufficient funds, unclear source of funds, not meeting the required 28-day period. **Example:** A Nepali student shows bank statements with sufficient funds equivalent to GBP 1,334 per month for living expenses (outside London) held for at least 28 days, plus their first year's tuition fees. - **Ward Verification Documents Required:**
  - Address verification certificate from local ward office
  - Name verification certificate
  - Income source verification
  - Birth certificate with ward office attestation
  - Family registration certificate
  - Property ownership verification (if applicable)

title: English Language Proficiency Proof
content: **Description:**  Evidence of meeting the required English language level set by your university, usually IELTS or TOEFL. **Obtaining in Nepal:** Taking the IELTS or TOEFL test at an authorized test center in Nepal. **Processing Time:** IELTS results are available within 13 days. TOEFL results are available within 6-10 days. **Cost:**  Varies depending on the test. IELTS costs around NPR 27,750 (as of November 2023). TOEFL costs around USD 215. **Validity:** Generally 2 years. **Common Mistakes:**  Not meeting the required score, expired test scores. **Example:** A Nepali student submits their IELTS score report with an overall band score of 6.5, meeting the university's entry requirement.

title: CAS (Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies)
content: Essential for visa application. **Processing Time:** Varies depending on the university. **Cost:** None. **Validity:**  Linked to your course start and end dates. **Common Mistakes:** Applying for a visa before receiving CAS, incorrect details on CAS. **Example:** A student receives their CAS from the University of Oxford after submitting their final transcript and paying the deposit.
